I'm not sure I understand the point to setting the IEditorInput to null, as it
will be held on to by the navigation history.  Bug 79638 describes the memory
expectations of an IEditorInput.  If your IEditorInput is large, then this is
going to cause problems regardless of whether it is set to null on the IEditorPart.

IEditorPart is specified in such a way that the IEditorInput must never be null.
 Implicitly, this condition must hold after init(IEditorSite,IEditorInput) is
called.

Also, by setting it to null, some of the functionality of the navigation history
becomes broken (i.e., input persistence via IPersistableElement).

No disagreement with the resolution, and I still feel that IEditorInput should
not be set to null.
